document.topic_text: Chairman/CEO Coastal Construction Group, Miami There’s a “definite slowdown in condominiums,” says Murphy. Although he doesn’t expect to see many condos move forward during the remainder of 2016, “it might be offset by the tremendous amount of large apartment buildings for rent, like I’ve never seen in this town,” Murphy says, citing the two 45-story apartment buildings included in the $2-billion Miami Worldcenter project in addition to proposals by another developer for 55- and 60-story for-rent projects. Firm in Focus 100 N. Biscayne Blvd., Miami CEO: Bernard Zyscovich LEED Accredited Staff: 23 Founded: 1977 More Mixed-Use: As the Brickell City Centre project wraps up final touches, Zyscovich Architects is working on a $150-million Aventura ParkSquare mixed-use project in Aventura, Fla. Did you enjoy this article? Click here to subscribe to Engineering News-Record Related Articles
